summary: The Accountability in Government Efficiency Act directs the Comptroller General of the United States to report to Congress on the actions of the Department of Government Efficiency, established by Executive Order 14158. The report must analyze the effects of the Department's actions, including those related to civil service employment, federal program termination, and program pausing/restarting, on the nation's long-term interests. It must also assess compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 and related laws. The report is due by December 31, 2025.
